title: Add static override for JDK TLS disabled/legacy algorithms in Java container
body:
Changes: 
* Add Java version-specific override to the security property jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms via a container image meta option
Noting that the property value is derived from internally built containers at 2.43.0 prior to the upgrade past 1.8.0_151 and 11.0.9 for Java 8 and 11, respectively. 

Fix: [#24623](https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/24623)

Tested: Added check to SdkHarnessEnvironmentTest to the java for to verify the TLS algorithms are available and shows that the override is propagated to the JVM image

title: Bump protobuf from 3.19.4 to 4.21.11 in /sdks/python
body:
Bumps [protobuf](https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf) from 3.19.4 to 4.21.11.
Release notes

Sourced from protobuf's releases.

Protocol Buffers v3.20.3

Java

  • Refactoring java full runtime to reuse sub-message builders and prepare to migrate parsing logic from parse constructor to builder.
  • Move proto wireformat parsing functionality from the private "parsing constructor" to the Builder class.
  • Change the Lite runtime to prefer merging from the wireformat into mutable messages rather than building up a new immutable object before merging. This way results in fewer allocations and copy operations.
  • Make message-type extensions merge from wire-format instead of building up instances and merging afterwards. This has much better performance.
  • Fix TextFormat parser to build up recurring (but supposedly not repeated) sub-messages directly from text rather than building a new sub-message and merging the fully formed message into the existing field.
  • This release addresses a Security Advisory for Java users

Protocol Buffers v3.20.2

C++

  • Reduce memory consumption of MessageSet parsing
  • This release addresses a Security Advisory for C++ and Python users

Protocol Buffers v3.20.1

PHP

  • Fix building packaged PHP extension (#9727)
  • Fixed composer.json to only advertise compatibility with PHP 7.0+. (#9819)

Ruby

  • Disable the aarch64 build on macOS until it can be fixed. (#9816)

Other

  • Fix versioning issues in 3.20.0

Protocol Buffers v3.20.1-rc1

#PHP

  • Fix building packaged PHP extension (#9727)

#Other

  • Fix versioning issues in 3.20.0

Protocol Buffers v3.20.0

2022-03-25 version 3.20.0 (C++/Java/Python/PHP/Objective-C/C#/Ruby/JavaScript)

Ruby

  • Dropped Ruby 2.3 and 2.4 support for CI and releases. (#9311)
  • Added Ruby 3.1 support for CI and releases (#9566).
  • Message.decode/encode: Add recursion_limit option (#9218/#9486)
  • Allocate with xrealloc()/xfree() so message allocation is visible to the Ruby GC. In certain tests this leads to much lower memory usage due to more frequent GC runs (#9586).
  • Fix conversion of singleton classes in Ruby (#9342)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=protobuf&package-manager=pip&previous-version=3.19.4&new-version=4.21.11)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: Bump httplib2 upper bound to 0.22.0.
body:
Version 0.21.0 was released on October 29th, 2022. Its [CHANGELOG](https://github.com/httplib2/httplib2/blob/master/CHANGELOG) only mentions one notable change:

```
http: `Content-Encoding: deflate` must accept zlib encapsulation
```

which is https://github.com/httplib2/httplib2/pull/230. This does not look like it should affect anything.

Closes https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/19929. Well, that issue was created a long time ago but we can repurpose it and close it automatically. It popped up when I searched for this in the issue tracker.

title: [Spark Dataset runner] Trigger evaluation using write noop format
body:
Spark 3 offers a build in way to force evaluation of a dataset, write using the `noop` format.
This implements this recommended way / best practice, see also https://holdenk.github.io/spark-flowchart/details/forced-computations/.

Using write noop seems to change how exceptions are propagated, the code to unwrap the respective cause is adjusted accordingly.

title: Bump protobuf from 3.19.4 to 4.21.10 in /sdks/python
body:
Bumps [protobuf](https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf) from 3.19.4 to 4.21.10.
Release notes

Sourced from protobuf's releases.

Protocol Buffers v3.20.3

Java

  • Refactoring java full runtime to reuse sub-message builders and prepare to migrate parsing logic from parse constructor to builder.
  • Move proto wireformat parsing functionality from the private "parsing constructor" to the Builder class.
  • Change the Lite runtime to prefer merging from the wireformat into mutable messages rather than building up a new immutable object before merging. This way results in fewer allocations and copy operations.
  • Make message-type extensions merge from wire-format instead of building up instances and merging afterwards. This has much better performance.
  • Fix TextFormat parser to build up recurring (but supposedly not repeated) sub-messages directly from text rather than building a new sub-message and merging the fully formed message into the existing field.
  • This release addresses a Security Advisory for Java users

Protocol Buffers v3.20.2

C++

  • Reduce memory consumption of MessageSet parsing
  • This release addresses a Security Advisory for C++ and Python users

Protocol Buffers v3.20.1

PHP

  • Fix building packaged PHP extension (#9727)
  • Fixed composer.json to only advertise compatibility with PHP 7.0+. (#9819)

Ruby

  • Disable the aarch64 build on macOS until it can be fixed. (#9816)

Other

  • Fix versioning issues in 3.20.0

Protocol Buffers v3.20.1-rc1

#PHP

  • Fix building packaged PHP extension (#9727)

#Other

  • Fix versioning issues in 3.20.0

Protocol Buffers v3.20.0

2022-03-25 version 3.20.0 (C++/Java/Python/PHP/Objective-C/C#/Ruby/JavaScript)

Ruby

  • Dropped Ruby 2.3 and 2.4 support for CI and releases. (#9311)
  • Added Ruby 3.1 support for CI and releases (#9566).
  • Message.decode/encode: Add recursion_limit option (#9218/#9486)
  • Allocate with xrealloc()/xfree() so message allocation is visible to the Ruby GC. In certain tests this leads to much lower memory usage due to more frequent GC runs (#9586).
  • Fix conversion of singleton classes in Ruby (#9342)

... (truncated)

title: Split some IO precommits out of the Java precommit
body:
I did this for IOs that already have a precommit job and added a couple others that are notably flaky.

Previously:

 - any change to any IO or Java core would cause unit tests for all IOs to run

Now:

 - any change to Java core causes unit tests for all IOs to run
 - any change to an IO causes only the IOs unit tests to run

title: [Spark Dataset runner] Reduce binary size of Java serialized task related for ParDo translation
body:
When investigating the performance of TPCDS query 83, I noticed that the query plan contains fairly heavy weight tasks. These trigger a Spark warning when the tasks get broadcasted because their serialized size (using Java serialization) is above 1MB. 

This is both a cleanup of the ParDo translation, but also reduces the serialized size of tasks that include many ParDos.

- Use subtypes of `DoFnMapPartitionsFactory` to handle the single output and multi-output case, rather than relying on a closure that has to be serialized.
- Use Java default collections rather than immutable Guava collections (Why does this matter for serialization???).
- Use `Collections.emptyList` and similar where applicable.

title: BigQuery Storage Write API extreme timestamp overflow fix
body:
Fix for https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/23636

Writing extreme  ( <1677-09-21, >2262-04-12) timestamp values to BigQuery via Storage Write API now fails due to `long overflow` exception, because conversion of timestamp to `micros` is done in `nanos`, overflowing `long` (see detailed analysis in https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/23636), although BigQuery supports such dates ([TIMESTAMP range](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/data-types#timestamp_type)).

------------------------

title: Apply task configuration avoidance to playground terraform gradle tasks
body:
This PR closes #24506 by applying gradle task configuration avoidance according to the playground terraform gradle tasks.  Essentially configuring the tasks as `task(String)` led to the gradle terraform plugin executing terraform init even for gradle projects unrelated to `playground:terraform`.

title: Return empty splits if unable to split, not errors (#24504)
body:
Return empty splits when unsuccessful and the state isn't corrupted. Errors should only return over the FnAPI for responses if processing is unable to continue. In particular, the SDK has to this day been returning errors when a split is impossible, rather than simply an empty response.

Resolves #24504

title: [Go SDK] RunInference wrapper supporting Sklearn Model Handler
body:
This PR adds RunInference Wrapper with Sklearn Model Handler. At present it only supports non-keyed input PCollection. Support for Keyed PCollection and Pytorch Model will be added in a later PR. 

The goal of this  PR is to mostly finalize the api interaction from user point of view. 

[Sample Job](https://pantheon.corp.google.com/dataflow/jobs/us-central1/2022-12-06_02_43_51-3485710757202640937;bottomTab=WORKER_LOGS;graphView=0;logsSeverity=INFO?pageState=(%22dfTime%22:(%22s%22:%222022-12-06T10:43:51.911Z%22,%22e%22:%222022-12-06T10:50:26.065Z%22))&project=google.com:clouddfe)

(I manually uploaded the tmp model to gcs bucket but I see that Java uses semi-persistent directory (if present) to load that.)

title: [release-2.44.0] Cherry-pick: Revert 23969 sqlttypes
body:
Fixes #24415

**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here

Cherry pick #24489 into release-2.44.0 branch.

Justification: #23969 introduced a regression in 2.44.0. It introduces SqlType.TIMESTAMP (micros_instant) logical type when converting from avro logical type TimestampMicros, but this Beam portable logical type is not yet supported in Beam SQL. Similar regression may occur other than Beam SQL where micros_instant is not supported.
